verses.text: Moreover, Job continued his parable, and said,
Oh that I were as \add in\add* months past, as \add in\add* the days \add when\add* God preserved me;
When his candle shined upon my head, \add and when\add* by his light I walked \add through\add* darkness;
As I was in the days of my youth, when the secret of God \add was\add* upon my tabernacle;
When the Almighty \add was\add* yet with me, \add when\add* my children \add were\add* about me;
When I washed my steps with butter, and the rock poured me out rivers of oil;
When I went out to the gate through the city, \add when\add* I prepared my seat in the street!
The young men saw me, and hid themselves: and the aged arose, \add and\add* stood up.
The princes refrained talking, and laid \add their\add* hand on their mouth.
The nobles held their peace, and their tongue cleaved to the roof of their mouth.
When the ear heard \add me\add* , then it blessed me; and when the eye saw \add me\add* , it gave witness to me:
Because I delivered the poor that cried, and the fatherless, and \add him that had\add* none to help him.
The blessing of him that was ready to perish came upon me: and I caused the widow's heart to sing for joy.
I put on righteousness, and it clothed me: my judgment \add was\add* as a robe and a diadem.
I was eyes to the blind, and feet \add was\add* I to the lame.
I \add was\add* a father to the poor: and the cause \add which\add* I knew not I searched out.
And I broke the jaws of the wicked, and plucked the spoil out of his teeth.
Then I said, I shall die in my nest, and I shall multiply \add my\add* days as the sand.
My root \add was\add* spread out by the waters, and the dew lay all night upon my branch.
My glory \add was\add* fresh in me, and my bow was renewed in my hand.
To me \add men\add* gave ear, and waited, and kept silence at my counsel.
After my words they spoke not again; and my speech dropped upon them.
And they waited for me as for the rain; and they opened their mouth wide \add as\add* for the latter rain.
\add If\add* I laughed on them, they believed \add it\add* not; and the light of my countenance they cast not down.
I chose out their way, and sat chief, and dwelt as a king in the army, as one \add that\add* comforteth the mourners.
